_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Earthgrains Refrigerated Dough Products is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety. This commitment is inherent to our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with our regulated processes. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible accidental releases of regulated substances. However, if such an accidental release does occur, we are coordinated with this facility?s Hazmat Team, local Fire Department, and the Clayton County Emergency Management Agency for emergency response support.

The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled

The Earthgrains Refrigerated Dough Products operations include the manufacturing of refrigerated bakery products for public consumption packaged under numerous brand names.  Ammonia  (Anhydrous) is the only RMP regulated substance present at this facility in a threshold quantity. It is utilized as the primary cooling media in our closed-loop refrigeration system. The system?s purpose is to provide refrigeration and cold storage capabilities for our product. Due to the size and characteristics of our ammonia refrigeration system, as well as Process Safety Management (PSM) applicability, this facility is covered under Program 3 of the RMP regulations.

The Worst Case Release Scenario(s) and the Alternative Release Scenario(s), including administrative controls and mitigation measures to limit the distances for each reported scenario have been completed as discussed in the following text.

To evaluate both the worst case and alternative release scenarios, EPA's Areal Locations of Hazardous Atmospheres [ALOHA(R)] was utilized exclusively. The RMP Comp model is referenced in the RMP Offsite Consequence Analysis Guidance as an acceptable model for the mathematical approximation process.

As specified in the RMP Guidance, the worst case and alternate case release scenarios have been calculated and the results of the calculations are on file at the Sara Lee Bakery Group. Public and environmental receptors that could possibly be affected by the scenarios were determined through the use of LANDVIEW 5 mapping system software and US Census Bureau 2000 data. 

The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

The facility has taken all necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements set forth in 40 CFR Part 68. The Sara Lee Bakery Group is also subject to the OSHA PSM standard under 29 CFR 1910.119, as well as the EPCRA Section 302 and 311/312 notification/reporting requirements.
                                                                                                                                                                                           Five-Year accident history                            .                                                                                                                                                                                    There have been no accidents in the past five years that resulted in offsite consequences or injuries.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
Emergency Response Plan

The Earthgrains Refrigerated Dough Products Emergency Response Policy focuses on evacuation of the facility in the event of an ammonia emergency, with the assistance local emergency response agencies performing rescue, firefighting, firs-aid, medical treatment, a

nd other response functions. The facility maintains a written Emergency Response Plan to document specific procedures to be implemented in the event of various emergencies, including ammonia release. The Emergency Release Plan includes procedures for facility evacuation, as well as for notification o the local emergency response agencies, which are responsible for notifying the public. The plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place within the facility that would require modified procedures.


Earthgrains Refrigerated Dough Products has devised a comprehensive emergency response program, designed to protect both employees and the community in the event of a release. This program is fully described in our Emergency Response Plan (ERP) in order to facilitate response efforts in the event of an off-site anhydrous ammonia release.  Included in the plan are measures to be taken internally by Sara Lee Bakery Group as well as measures to be taken by off-site response agencies.  

Earthgrains Refrigerated Dough Products has trained on-site personnel to respond to accidental ammonia releases. These personnel are trained in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.120, Hazardous Operations and Emergency Response regulations according to their duties and function. These personnel also receive initial training and annual update training thereafter.   In addition, simulations of emergency releases with off-site effects are conducted periodically in cooperation of the Clayton County Emergency Management Agency, Local Fire Department, and Local Emergency Planning Committee.  

To assure that the local governmental response agencies are familiar with Earthgrains Refrigerated Dough Products emergency response procedures, Earthgrains Refrigerated Dough Products has provided copies of the ERP for review and approval by the local agencies. 

To plan for an ammonia release with off-site effects, Earthgrains Refrigerated Dough Products ERP includes procedures/equipment to m

itigate the release, procedures to inform local response agencies, transportation maps for response agencies, evacuation route maps, and procedures for public communication.

In addition to the above local response agencies, Earthgrains Refrigerated Dough Products has arranged emergency response backup and assistance with a local clean-up contractor.

In the event of an anhydrous ammonia release with off site effects, the general public will be warned using the methods described in our Emergency Response Plan (ERP) and as prearranged by off-site agency designated officials.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety:

Earthgrains Refrigerated Dough Products aim is to provide a professional service as efficiently as possible while minimizing the use of toxic materials wherever and whenever prudent.  In this effort our highest priority will be the proactive pursuit of cost-effective process changes that reduce or eliminate the use and/or generation of hazardous toxics at the endpoint of service.  Where hazardous toxics cannot be eliminated, improving controls to handle these substances will be explored and implemented wherever possible.
